newsitem.title: UK: GOLF-LIGHTNING FINISH KEEPS MONTGOMERIE AHEAD.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-LIGHTNING FINISH KEEPS MONTGOMERIE AHEAD.

text.p: Scotland's Colin Montgomerie birdied three of the last four holes to maintain his one-shot lead after the third round of the European Grand Prix on Saturday.
Only a frustrating bogey at the last prevented the reigning European number one from increasing his overnight lead.
Earlier Montgomerie fell a stroke behind defending champion Retief Goosen of South Africa and England's Lee Westwood despite saving from 40ft on the ninth and collecting two birdies.
After lightning held up play for two hours in the afternoon, Montgomerie returned to the course to reassert his dominance, finishing at four-under for an 11-under-par total of 205.
Westwood returned to miss a 10ft birdie putt to equal the course record 65 and remained one shot off the pace.
Goosen's 68 left him on 206 with Westwood, two strokes ahead of England's Jamie Spence and Scott Henderson of Scotland.
Montgomerie, seeking his first win of the year before next week's US Open, grabbed the lead with birdies on the 15th, 16th and 17th holes.
The Scot hit a 40-yard chip to 10ft and followed up with two more 10-footers to go two ahead of the field before a loose drive and then a wide approach shot on the last led to a bogey.
"The finish was unfortunate, only my second bogey of the week, because a 67 would have kept me on target," said Montgomerie.
"I predicted 16-under-par would win this, so if I'm right, I'll need a 67 in the final round now to win."
